oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Tom T. Hall interview - Biff Collie - Happy Hour - 1983-01-24
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Recording of an interview with Tom T. Hall (performer/songwriter), conducted by Biff Collie for his radio program Happy Hour on January 24, 1983.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Tom T. Hall talks about not having a middle initial until he came to Nashville -- Biff Collie talks about meeting Tom T. Hall in New York -- Hall talks about coming to Nashville from Roanoke, VA. And being born in Kentucky -- Hall talks about going to school for writing in Roanoke and also doing radio work -- Hall talks about the first song he wrote, D. J. For A Day -- Hall talks about his father being an ordained preacher -- Hall talks about having religious influence in some of his songs -- Hall talks about his songwriting process -- Hall talks about how music as an art form generates so much money -- Hall talks about Doug Kershaw -- Hall talks about teaching songwriting and the different types of people who write songs -- Hall talks about serving in the army -- Hall talks about his favorite song often being the ones he is currently working on -- Hall concludes the interview
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Hall, Tom T.; Collie, Biff;
